sentences.english: They all raised the standard of revolt against the tyrant.
sentences.chinese: 他们都举起义旗，反对暴君。

sentences.english: She rules her family like a real despot.
A safer strategy is to lie low and stay out of the way of the tyrant boss.
sentences.chinese: 有一个安全的策略是低姿态，离暴君老板远点。

sentences.english: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
sentences.chinese: 自由之树必须以爱国者和暴君的血灌溉既开花。

sentences.english: The people designated the King as a tyrant.
Jie, the last ruler, was said to be a corrupt king.
sentences.chinese: 桀，夏朝的最后一个统治者，被说成是一个暴君。

sentences.english: With western-backed despots being turfed out politics has changed for ever.
sentences.chinese: 当西方支持的暴君被赶走，政局长远地变化了。

sentences.english: As a roaring lion, and a hungry bear, so is a wicked prince over the poor people.
sentences.chinese: 暴君欺凌贫穷弱小，有如咆哮怒狮，饥饿野熊。

sentences.english: According to a legend Hiranyakshipu was a demon king.
sentences.chinese: 据说，希兰亚卡西普是一个暴君。

sentences.english: Oh, I forgot you,'' said the tyrant.
The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time, with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
sentences.chinese: 自由之树必须不时以爱国者与暴君的鲜血浇灌。

sentences.english: He ran a sword through the tyrant.
While the tyrant was hanged, but they hang out and the US-British coalition forces.
sentences.chinese: 暴君虽然被绞死了，但是美英联军却赖着不走了。

sentences.english: Valentine tyrant of the line of child feel sad.
sentences.chinese: 瓦沦丁对暴君的虐行感到非常难过。

sentences.english: And populaces, like tyrants, require buffoons.
sentences.chinese: 而群氓和暴君都需要逗乐的小丑。

sentences.english: Then Cleitus spoke true. l have become a tyrant.
sentences.chinese: 克雷塔斯说的是真的，我已经成了暴君。

definition: Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
Bai Qi (-258 BC), famous general of Qin 秦國|秦国, the victor at 長平|长平 in 260 BC/same as 公孫起|公孙起
Marco Polo (1254-c. 1324), Venetian trader and explorer who traveled the Silk road to China, author of Il Milione (Travels of Marco Polo)
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
Daji (c. 11th century BC), concubine of the last Shang dynasty king Zhou Xin 紂辛|纣辛[Zhou4 Xin1]
